intro: Cytisopsis leiocalycina, commonly known as the yellow crotalaria, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as an annual or perennial herb, often found in disturbed soils and open habitats. It has small, bean-like pods that contain seeds, and it is sometimes used in traditional medicine. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and agricultural research.
